keyMoments.title: Robin Reads the Poneglyph
keyMoments.description: Robin reads the Poneglyph in the Tomb of the Kings and reveals to Crocodile that it doesn't mention Pluton, only historical information about Arabasta.
keyMoments.significance: Crucial moment where Robin's ability to read Poneglyphs is demonstrated, and the revelation that Crocodile's entire plan was based on false assumptions.
keyMoments.quote: Nothing of the name Pluton is mentioned.

keyMoments.title: Crocodile Betrays and Stabs Robin
keyMoments.description: After revealing the Poneglyph's contents, Crocodile accuses Robin of lying and stabs her with his poisoned hook, declaring she's no longer useful. He reveals he never trusted her during their four years together.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the end of Robin's partnership with Crocodile and sets up her eventual rescue by Luffy and joining the Straw Hat crew. One of the most pivotal moments in Robin's character arc.

bounties.reason: Knowledge of Poneglyphs and ability to read ancient texts

relationships.description: Robin's partnership with Crocodile ends in this episode when he betrays and stabs her after she reveals the Poneglyph doesn't mention Pluton.

evolutionMoments.description: Crocodile stabs Robin with his poisoned hook, ending their four-year partnership and revealing he never trusted her.

relationships.description: Robin forces King Cobra to lead her to the Poneglyph in the Tomb of the Kings.

evolutionMoments.description: Robin uses Cobra to access the Poneglyph and reads it in front of Crocodile.

reveals.information: Crocodile betrays Robin by stabbing her with his poisoned hook after she reveals the Poneglyph doesn't mention Pluton
Crocodile reveals he never trusted Robin from the beginning of their four-year partnership

keyMoments.title: Crocodile Arrives at the Tomb of the Kings
keyMoments.description: Crocodile enters the Tomb of the Kings to hear Robin's translation of the Poneglyph and finally learn the location of Pluton.
keyMoments.significance: The culmination of Crocodile's entire Operation Utopia plan, where he expects to gain the power of an Ancient Weapon.

keyMoments.title: Crocodile Stabs Robin
keyMoments.description: When Robin reveals the Poneglyph doesn't mention Pluton, Crocodile betrays her by stabbing her with his poisoned hook, declaring she's no longer useful and that he never trusted her.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Crocodile's ruthless nature and willingness to discard anyone who can't help him achieve his goals. Reveals the true extent of his villainy.
keyMoments.quote: You've been useful for the four years we've been together. However, you would have to die since you broke your promise. I never trusted you from the beginning.

bounties.reason: Former bounty before becoming a Warlord of the Sea

relationships.description: Crocodile's partnership with Robin ends when he betrays her, revealing he never trusted her during their four years working together.

evolutionMoments.description: Crocodile stabs Robin after she reveals the Poneglyph doesn't mention Pluton, ending their partnership.

relationships.description: Crocodile continues to be pursued by Luffy for his crimes against Alabasta.

evolutionMoments.description: After reviving, Luffy races to the Tomb to confront Crocodile for the third time.

reveals.information: Crocodile reveals he never trusted Robin from the beginning of their partnership, showing his inability to trust anyone
When the Poneglyph doesn't reveal Pluton's location, Crocodile's entire plan crumbles, revealing it was built on incomplete information

keyMoments.title: Luffy Revives from Dehydration
keyMoments.description: After being defeated and dehydrated by Crocodile, Luffy miraculously revives when water falls on him, demonstrating his incredible resilience.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's determination and sets up the third and final confrontation with Crocodile. Demonstrates that water can counter Crocodile's powers.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Chases Crocodile to the Tomb
keyMoments.description: After recovering, Luffy races toward the Tomb of the Kings to confront Crocodile for the third time, refusing to give up despite being defeated twice.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's unwavering determination and sets up the climactic final battle of the Arabasta Arc.

relationships.description: Luffy continues his pursuit of Crocodile to stop his plan and save Alabasta.

evolutionMoments.description: After reviving from Crocodile's attack, Luffy races to the Tomb for their third confrontation.

relationships.description: Despite being a Marine, Tashigi helps Luffy find Crocodile's location.

evolutionMoments.description: Tashigi directs Luffy to where Crocodile went, showing growing respect despite their opposing sides.

name.japanese: ネフェルタリ・コブラ

keyMoments.title: Cobra Activates Self-Destruct Mechanism
keyMoments.description: King Cobra activates the mechanism that will cause the Tomb of the Kings to collapse, willing to sacrifice himself to stop Crocodile from escaping with dangerous knowledge.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Cobra's dedication to protecting his kingdom's secrets and his willingness to make the ultimate sacrifice as a leader.

relationships.description: Robin forces Cobra to lead her to the Poneglyph in the Tomb of the Kings.

evolutionMoments.description: Cobra witnesses Robin reading the Poneglyph and Crocodile's betrayal.

relationships.description: Cobra activates the self-destruct mechanism to stop Crocodile.

evolutionMoments.description: Cobra takes drastic action to prevent Crocodile from escaping.

reveals.information: Cobra demonstrates his willingness to sacrifice himself to protect his kingdom's secrets and stop Crocodile

keyMoments.title: Tashigi Helps Luffy Find Crocodile
keyMoments.description: Despite being a Marine, Tashigi directs Luffy toward Crocodile's location after some internal conflict.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Tashigi's moral complexity and her growing understanding that justice isn't always black and white.
keyMoments.quote: That way... he went that way.

relationships.description: Tashigi helps Luffy despite being a Marine, showing her conflicted feelings about the situation.

evolutionMoments.description: Tashigi directs Luffy to Crocodile's location despite her duty as a Marine.

reveals.information: Tashigi shows her willingness to help pirates when faced with greater injustice, revealing her moral complexity
